info.title: Bitcoin Snap Client RPC API
info.description: RPC methods exposed via the onClientRequest handler in the Bitcoin Wallet Snap.

methods.name: startSendTransactionFlow
methods.description: Initiates the send transaction flow for the specified account, potentially displaying UI and returning the transaction ID if successful.

params.name: account
params.description: The account ID to use for the transaction.

params.name: scope
params.description: The Bitcoin scope (network). Not used internally but validated.

params.name: assetId
params.description: The asset ID. Not used internally but validated.

result.name: sendTransactionResponse
result.description: The result of the send operation, or null if cancelled.

methods.name: signAndSendTransaction
methods.description: Signs and sends a partially signed Bitcoin transaction (PSBT) for the specified account.

params.name: accountId
params.description: The account ID to use for signing and sending.

params.name: scope
params.description: The Bitcoin scope (network). Not used internally but validated.

result.name: sendTransactionResponse
result.description: The result of the send operation, or null if failed.
